intro: Secamone urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet secamone, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical environments, often in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, and the flowers are clustered in inflorescences with bright colors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
